name: Pramiracetam
summary: Pramiracetam is a synthetic nootropic of the racetam family, used to enhance memory, learning, and cognitive performance. It is more potent than piracetam and has a distinct pharmacological profile.
description: Pramiracetam is a fat-soluble racetam derivative developed in the late 1970s. It is thought to work primarily by enhancing high-affinity choline uptake, thereby increasing acetylcholine synthesis and availability in the hippocampus. This mechanism is believed to underlie its effects on learning and memory. Pramiracetam is not FDA-approved in the United States but is prescribed in some European countries for cognitive decline, dementia, and brain injury recovery.

off_label_uses: Learning and memory enhancement in healthy individuals
contraindications: Hypersensitivity to pramiracetam or other racetams

items: Treatment of cognitive decline associated with dementia
Adjunctive therapy for brain injury recovery

sections.text: Pramiracetam enhances high-affinity choline uptake in the hippocampus, increasing acetylcholine availability and thereby improving processes involved in memory formation and learning.

adult.Cognitive disorders: 600 mg orally twice daily (1,200 mg/day total)
adult.Brain injury recovery: Up to 1,500 mg/day in divided doses

sections.geriatric: Standard dosing; monitor for sensitivity and adjust as needed

sections.text: Onset: May take days to weeks for full effect; Duration: sustained with continued use

other: May increase anxiety in susceptible individuals
Avoid use in severe renal or hepatic impairment

sections.text: Not associated with dependence, but gradual reduction may prevent potential rebound in symptoms
